Description: Parian marble bust of Jupiter Serapis; modius restored.
Curator's comments: Jenkins & Sloan 1996 Sarapis (Latin Serapis) was a benign god of fertility, his head crowned with a modius or corn basket. His cult is said by Tacitus to have been brought by Ptolemy I to Egypt from Sinope on the Black Sea, and from there it spread throughout the Greek and later, Roman world. The sculpture appears in the portrait of Sir William and his wife Catherine, where it is displayed on the Capri altar (Jenkins & Sloan 1996, nos 129, 130a). LITERATURE: D'Hancarville, MS Catalogue, 1, pp. 6-7.
